intro: Ctenardisia ovandensis, commonly known as the Ovandensis Ctenardisia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of red or purple. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
